network_overview: The 15-minute capture shows only idle L2TP keep-alive tunnels on UDP/1701 and one GTPv2-C Echo Request that never received a reply; no user-plane GTP-U, Diameter, SIP or voice traffic is present. All flows are sub-1 pkt/s heart-beat traffic between private address pairs, indicating a quiet lab or standby RAN-backhaul segment.

observations.finding: Eight identical 32-packet L2TP flows (48 B each, 0.04 pkt/s) are pure keep-alive; no subscriber data observed
One GTPv2-C Echo Request (msg-type 0x1a, TEI 0x00000000) sent from 10.47.81.138→10.47.81.124 remains unanswered, so the path or peer GTP-C stack appears down
Zero SIP, RTP, Diameter or IMS traffic; no VoLTE/VoNR calls present

root_causes.description: The lone GTPv2-C Echo Request (Tx:pkt_544) was never echoed, indicating the remote GTP-C entity (likely S-GW or UPF) is administratively down, fire-walled, or mis-configured with wrong UDP port 2123.
root_causes.impact: Control-plane procedures (Create Session, Modify Bearer) will fail, preventing any 4G/5G bearer setup even if user-plane tunnels exist.

recommendations.action: Verify IP connectivity and UDP 2123 reachability between 10.47.81.138 and 10.47.81.124; check firewall rules and GTP-C service status on the receiving node.
recommendations.rationale: Restoring Echo reply proves GTP-C path health and unblocks bearer-setup procedures.

recommendations.action: Enable GTP-U TEID assignment and capture on the same link to confirm user-plane mirroring is working; current classifier shows 0 GTP tunnels.
recommendations.rationale: Ensures both planes are visible for future troubleshooting.

recommendations.action: Consider tuning L2TP keep-alive interval from 30s to 60s on the LAC/LNS to halve background load in production.
recommendations.rationale: Reduces unnecessary CPU and bandwidth on legacy 2G/3G back-haul while maintaining tunnel liveness.

session_analysis.signaling_health: Only one GTPv2-C Echo sent; no reply → path questionable. No Diameter, S1-AP, NGAP or L2TP control errors seen.
session_analysis.user_plane_health: Zero GTP-U tunnels; all UDP/1701 traffic is L2TP data-channel keep-alives with no subscriber IP frames inside.
session_analysis.voice_quality: No IMS signalling or RTP detected; voice service idle.
session_analysis.cross_plane_correlation: Bearer-independent L2TP heart-beats run over the same IP network that should carry GTP-C; failure of GTP-C Echo implies the transport is partly impaired or filtered.

sequence_diagram:
sequenceDiagram
    participant MME as 10.47.81.138 (MME/SGSN)
    participant SGW as 10.47.81.124 (S-GW/UPF)
    MME->>SGW: GTPv2-C Echo Request (TEI=0, seq=?)
    Note right of SGW: No reply received
    SGW-->>MME: <timeout>
    Note left of MME: GTP-C path assumed down
    MME->>MME: Bearer setup blocked
